title: Messages download repeatedly when I add a Gmail-hosted address as a new IMAP account
content:
Iâ€™m a new user, using Thunderbird v. 115.13.0 (64-bit), running under Windows 10. If you can help me with the following problem, Iâ€™ll be grateful.

I added three already-existing Gmail accounts to Thunderbird using IMAP, and everything was working fine. But when a week later I added a fourth account (once again with IMAP) -- not a gmail.com account this time, but one hosted by Gmail -- Thunderbird did strange things with the downloading of all the messages. It seemed at first to be working fine: downloading first all the message headers, then the messages in the Inbox, then those in the All Mail folder and in various other folders. I began using the new account, and everything seemed good.

But later on it started downloading all the Inbox messages again (only for this new account), but this time progressively more slowly. In fact, it slowed Thunderbird down so much that it became unusable.

I quit Thunderbird and restarted, but that didnâ€™t help: It began once again to download inbox messages, very slowly, making Thunderbird once again unusably slow.

At this point I deleted the new account (including all the message data), then added it once again. But I ran into the same problem.

The Inbox in Gmail has about 37,000 messages, and the All Mail folder, about 47,000. There are no messages in the Trash.

Thanks very much for any help you can give me.

All the best, Alan

title: Network errors cause filters to be disabled and the target rule deleted
content:
I've discovered that network errors cause filters to be disabled and the target rule deleted. This has caused me to have to go edit dozens of rules to get filters working again.

I have seen this with two scenarios: 1. Expired certificate on my mail server 2. Flaky (as in really flaky) WiFi in the hotel I am currently staying in

Both of these are a big problem. Network errors should not cause problems with filter definitions and deleting the targets is a really bad idea. I'm okay with having to rerun the filters, but not having to spend minutes to hours repairing the filter rules.

title: Global search doesn't work as it should.
content:
Dear Sir or Madam, I have already described my problem in the Thunderbird forum and in the Mozilla group chat. Unfortunately, nobody was able to help me. A senior forum member told me that this problem was known, but that nobody was looking into it. Now to my problem: According to their help pages for Thunderbird, you can search partial expressions and complete expressions in the global search. To do this, you put the complete expression in inverted commas. I have tried this several times with different expressions. Unfortunately, no matter whether with or without inverted commas, only the partial expression is searched for. Example: "D-Link" Thunderbird searches for Link and not for D-Link. I have also restarted the search indexing. Unfortunately without any improvement. So my question is: are you aware of the problem? If so, are you endeavouring to rectify the error? If so, when?

with kind regards JÃ¼rgen Huber

title: Cannot add security module for smartcard device Linux.
content:
Recently updated to Ubuntu 24.04, which required me to move from repository-installed Thunderbird to using Flatpak or snap. With either install, when I try to add the security module for my smartcard reader, via Settings - Privacy & Security - Security Devices - Load, I get "Unable to add module" with no further information. The error console doesn't show anything either. The module I'm trying to install is:

/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/pkcs11/opensc-pkcs11.so

I've also tried adding the smartcard drivers from the vendor with the same result.

The snap version of Firefox works fine with the smartcard without having to add the security module, it was already installed.

I've been using Thunderbird fine for many years with my smartcard under Linux. It's just with this switch to Flatpak/snap install that's caused the problem. Any help would be appreciated.

title: Thunderbird has become worse on Mac OS 10.14
content:
I recently updated my Thunderbird client to v115.0b6 (on a 2012 Macbook Pro with Mac OS 10.14), and as so many apps nowadays, it has become worse instead of better: - There is a large margin on the left side of the subject column in the email list which wastes a lot of space. How can I hide it? - Performance is worse: The update of the mailing list and the spam filtering is significantly slower than before. Often takes a second for 2-3 items. Why should an update with basically the same functionality ever become slower? - The issue that external images are never shown to me even after I have allowed external contents to be shown is still not solved.

title: IMAP email on Thunderbird with Virginmedia login failing-DNS issue+App Password +VPN
content:
First off, this is an answer I wanted to share rather than a request for help. Spent significant time over the weekend helping family/friends with Virgin Media account and Thunderbird [Version 115.13.0 (64-bit)] on Win10. Virgin Media have introduced app passwords recently and all was fine until a recent update of Thunderbird. Ever since the account has refused to connect to the IMAP server. Other accounts with similar authentication methods worked but this one failed.

Issue Reproduction : System : Win10, Thunderbird 115.13.0, Norton VPN running

1. Have Thunderbird configured with the virginmedia account (by the time it worked we had removed the app password from the Thunderbird saved passwords) 2. Select the VirginMedia account INBOX in the left hand window of Thunderbird 3. Click on the download (Get) new message button (cloud with the down arrow, top left of Thunderbird) 4. Thunderbird then says it is connecting to the IMAP server (bottom of mail window), waits a while, then the message disappears and nothing happens. No new messages download, no request for the account password, no error messages, just nothing. 5. On trying to send mail there is no request for the password the system just refuses to connect to the SMTP server.

I had checked a few things on the cmd line and found that the DNS resolution of the virginmedia IMAP server was failing on lookup every time. Below is incorrect: Non-authoritative answer: Name: imap.virginmedia.com Address: 10.100.10.100

With the VPN turned off, the following was the result : Non-authoritative answer: Name: imap-virginmedia-com.edge.unified.services Address: 84.116.6.19 Aliases: imap.virginmedia.com

  • Turned the VPN back on again after running the [nslookup imap.virginmedia.com] command*

This is the solution, I found that worked for this instance. But as mentioned I spent significant time search for answer in the settings on Tbird and looking online for ideas. There was nothing that specifically reference this but a couple of ideas lead me to this.

SOLUTION 1. Start Thunderbird, go to the Tools Menu, then Settings and select it 2. In the new tab/window that opens select General on the left hand side, then scroll down to Network and Disk space 3. Click on the Settings button next to Configure how Thunderbird connects to the Internet 4. Scroll down the 'Connection Settings window that opens, to the bottom of the page 5. Tick the box next to Enable DNS over HTTPS (I left the Use Provider set to Custom and the Custom field blank) then Click the OK button. Make sure you click ok, don't just close the window. 6. Then I did a restart of Thunderbird (probably not necessary but just to make sure changes had propagated through the system). 7. Then repeated the download of new messages request with the VirginMedia account, was then prompted for the app password, which I re-entered and marked to save. New messages were then downloaded to the system. 8. Composed a new message and sent it, re-entering the password & marking save it, again (as separate entries in the password table for IMAP & SMTP). New message was sent successfully, copied to the sent folder and received correctly at the destination.

As mentioned, caveats : I don't work for Mozilla, I am a user like you, this worked for this system. I have taken the time to type this out in the hope it helps someone else, as I couldn't find this exact solution on the forums I searched. Thanks

title: Thunderbird error "SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE" but my cert is valid
content:
Hello everyone,

I'm facing a problem with Thunderbird. I have my own mail server that uses an SSL certificate issued by GoDaddy. I checked the certificate and contacted support; they assured me the certificate is valid and not revoked or expired (see OCSP-Check.jpg)*.

However, when I try to configure my account on Thunderbird, it doesn't work. I receive an error stating that the certificate is revoked (see Error-Console.jpg)* and (Error-MSG.jpg).

Disabling the OCSP check allows it to work, but I need to understand why this is happening only in Thunderbird.

I reiterate that it is working normally on Outlook and Android

Some information about my mail server:

Software: Zimbra 8.8.15 OS: Debian APACHE IMAP port: 993 SMTP port: 465 SSL

If you need any further information, I'll be happy to provide it.

Thanks in advance.

title: Announcement from Microsoft re my Outlook.com email
content:
I have an email account with Microsoft -. I receive and read/ manage my mail using Thunderbird. I received the following message from Microsoft (see below). Can you please advise me what to do to maintain my access through Thunderbird. Thank you for your help NP

_______________________________________ Update your sign-in technology before September 16th, 2024 to maintain email access.

The safety and security of your information is top priority for Microsoft. To help keep your account secure, Microsoft will no longer support the use of third-party email and calendar apps which ask you to sign in with only your Microsoft Account username and password. To keep you safe you will need to use a mail or calendar app which supports Microsoftâ€™s modern authentication methods. If you do not act, your third-party email apps will no longer be able to access your Outlook.com, Hotmail or Live.com email address on September 16th.


What do you need to do?

If you are receiving this email, you are currently using an email or calendar app that uses a less secure authentication method to connect to your Outlook.com email account. You will need to upgrade your third-party mail and calendar app to a version which supports modern authentication methods.


Microsoft provides free versions of Outlook for your PC, Mac, iOS, and Android devices which can be easily downloaded and connect to your email account. Using an updated version of an Outlook application will ensure you are connecting in the most secure way.


How can you set up your Gmail, Apple Mail, or other third-party mail application?

Various non-Microsoft applications will have their own steps for connecting to your Outlook.com email account using modern authentication methods. See our help article - Modern Authentication Methods now needed to continue syncing Outlook Email in non-Microsoft email apps. However, you may need to contact the creators of those applications to provide you with instructions. In many cases, simply removing and re-adding your account with the latest version of that application will configure it to use modern authentication methods. __________________

title: What just happened to my Thunderbird profile and why won't it start properly?
content:
Ok, I just had issues with Thunderbird after a very long time of no problems. Last was the "Assembling message" prompt that seems to have gone away. Today, however, I have a brand new one that makes no sense to me.

On the PC this morning with no issues and e-mail was fine. Thunderbird told me there was an update so I applied it and shut down the PC. Came back about 6:30PM and fired up the PC and, when I started Thunderbird, it prompted me to create a new e-mail account! What? I checked my profile and it was still there and I even compared it to my last differential backup and it appears to be right. Not corrupted.

Using the profile manager, I see it still knows where the profile is located and I even clicked it, selected it and said use it but it again started with the "create a new account"! Tried the usual methods of creating a new profile, renaming, using the old data, etc. but, every time I try, it only gets me to the "create new account" interface.

I even went so far as to revert to a previous Windows restore point to get back to the previous version of Thunderbird but it STILL does not want to use the existing profile. Uninstalled and reinstalled Thunderbird and again tried to point to the old profile and no joy. It simply does not want to use the existing profile.

Normally when I build a new PC or reload Windows to start fresh, I am always able to point Thunderbird at my old profile like nothing changed and it always worked. Today, however, it does not want to use what I was using this morning.

Anyone else get this today?

title: To combat scammers, please have a column that shows the email (or domain) of incoming emails
content:
Please provide a column that shows the real address / domain of incoming emails.

Many emails now pretend to come from a safe legitimate company, but you cannot easily spot them in Thunderbird. Thunderbird's Correspondents column shows the fake company name they are using, which is not helpful. The From column shows the same information (the fake name, but not the email address), so that doesn't help.

So I cannot tell the scam emails without clicking on the email and looking at it, which is dangerous. 

Solution options:

1. Change the From column to report full address 2. Allow user to define what to show in From column (Name / Full email / Domain / Combination) 3. New columns "Sender Email Address" and "Sending Domain" 4. Add smarts to Thunderbird to highlight/block/move messages where sender is from visibly false address.

I hope you can jump onto this quickly. It would be a massively helpful popular feature.

Thank you. Derek

title: Tbird 115.10.1 crashing in garbage collect

title: Thunderbird Not Downloading All Emails Into All Folders from Gmail Labels Despite "Synchronize all messages locally regardless of age"
content:
Hi, helping my 80 year old father to try Thunderbird because he has a massive amount of emails and folders/labels (literally thousands of folders/labels!!!) and Outlook can't handle it unless you Archive stuff which is annoying and cumbersome.

His email account is with Google Gmail.

So far, Thunderbird is handling attempting to fully sync with his Gmail account much better than Outlook.

However, after downloading thousands of emails into a large portion of the thousands of folders & sub-folders, Thunderbird stopped doing that.

If I click on an individual folder, it instantly starts downloading them, and I only have to click on each folder quickly and then Thunderbird will eventually downloading all the emails into all the folders I have clicked on.

However, my Dad has THOUSANDS of folders so even clicking on each one quickly would take a very....long....time.

I have researched this a bunch and I've verified the following:

Account Settings --> Synchronization & Storage --> Message Synchronizing --> Keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer = ON

Account Settings --> Synchronization & Storage --> Disk Space --> Synchronize all messages locally regardless of age = ON

I have also done the following:

Settings --> General --> very bottom right of list Config Editor --> mail.server.default.check_all_folders_for_new = changed to "true"

No luck so far.

If someone wants to switch to Thunderbird and has a huge number of folders, and wants to download all emails so that any email will show up in a search, there must be a better way to get Thunderbird to download them all in an automated way, no?

title: Colors have gone CRAZY
content:
Hello all,

I just installed Thunderbird on a new computer today and migrated an account from an old computer. I'm looking at previous posts for migration issues.

The pressing issue right now is the color scheme in both Thunderbird AND Windows.

I installed Thunderbird (Version 102.15.1 32-bit because that's what I had on my old computer) and it had its standard colors. I was personalizing the appearance in the settings. I suddenly -- not when I was doing any adjustments to colors, fonts, anything at all -- got the most awful shades of pink and peach, and get this -- not only in Thunderbird, but in Windows! (Windows 10 Pro) I had changed absolutely nothing in my Windows display. I simply set up Thunderbird, moved to close it and did close it, and everything on my computer changed. The Windows taskbar is still my normal color, but buttons within Windows, borders and buttons on ALL of my apps such as my browser (Iron Browser), you name it ...... something happened within Thunderbird and to my entire computer. I can't get rid of it by changing the customize appearance in Windows.

I didn't do anything! Except maybe I did? I wasn't doing anything at the time within my Thunderbird settings when it happened -- I know that -- but it did happen while I was looking at Thunderbird's settings and when I closed it. Does anybody have any idea as to what I may have inadvertently done, and how to undo it?

Thank you SO much.

title: Mails Summary File (MSF) Formatting
content:
Dear All:

I have been using Mozilla Thunderbird for nigh on 20 years now and have always used the the DEFAULT INBOX MSF file listing as shown in the attached screenshot entitled " MSF Normal Legacy Format", namely 

                                            Correspondent, Subject, Date

with all entries sorted in chronological order and new emails entries in bold.

I encountered my first ever "Building Summary file for Inbox" in 20 years.

All the inbox emails were rebuild BUT the format of the rebuild is completely different now with an extremely annoying format of: 

                                           Correspondent,             > Subject            Date

where the > symbol launches a tree or layered listing of previously dated inbox emails linked by the subject title as shown in the attached screenshot "MSF File Rebuild Tree or Layered Format"

THIS IS EXTREMELY IRRITATING AS IT CORRUPTS THE TRUE CHRONOLOGICAL LISTING.

Could you please advise how I can change the format of the MSF file shown in the "MSF Normal Legacy Format" where emails are just as: 

                                                      Correspondent, Subject, Date  in chrono order without the treeing or layering.

My version of Mozilla Thunderbird is 115.13.0 (64 Bit) running on Windows 7 Professional

Thanks.

title: Cannot attach large file after upgraded to 115
content:
Since we upgraded to 115, most of our PC cannot forward email larger than 5MB to team members. One or two PC can sometimes send without problem but not always.

We can press "forward" and the compose new email window comes up as it has always been. But when we press "send", it will stall for a while then responded "Cannot send email". Press "OK" and sometimes it will then respond "Creating email" or something like that. The sequence could be reversed (create first then cannot send). Cannot even save as Draft into the Draft folder on our own manged MDaemon mail server on our local LAN.

Thinking it is all due to the forwarded email being too big, tried many many times over weeks checking MD setting, LAN and individual local PC setting but still cannot resolve.

Today I tried something completely different. Instead of "forwarding one large email", I tried to attach large attachments like .jpg etc and found that it is the "attachment process" that is causing the problem. If I attach a larger file, say 10MB, it is problem. If I attach several small files, it sometimes go through even the total file size exceed 10MB. The I tried attaching just a few attachments, save to draft folder, close the compose window, re-select the draft email and then add more file. Repeating this several times I managed to be able to save to draft folder on the server and then send out an email of 49.9MB. I keep on playing with it for hours but I could repeat and can only managed to do something like 10MB/11MB.

This is still much better than trying to "forward an email" (as attachment or in-line) which we can only do up to about 5MB max.

Please help to resole this problem.

title: Can You Somehow Merge a Sub-Folder from Folder A with a Same-name Sub-Folder in Folder B?
content:
I'm helping my 80 year old father with quite a mess with his email.

He's been using Outlook for about 40 years, and back in 2021, his email service provider, Telus here in Canada, switched their email service over to Google Gmail, and long story short, the switchover from Telus' in-house email service to a Telus-branded Google email service ended up causing a real mess with my Dad's email, due to his main laptop's Outlook desktop application getting switched from IMAP to POP, whereas his Microsoft Surface remained Outlook IMAP, for the past 3.5 years, so they got totally out of sync from each other in some very complicated ways for which there seems no simple fix.

I offer that background just to perhaps explain what I'm about to ask.

In Thunderbird, if there is:

1) a Folder named "Alpha" with a bunch of Sub-Folders

2) a Folder named "Alpha New" with a bunch of Sub-Folders, many of which have the same names of the Sub-Folders within "Alpha" but many of the Sub-Folders having totally different names

and you want to amalgamate the Sub-Folders in the Folder "Alpha" with the Sub-Folders in the Folder "Alpha New,"

and for example you have:

1) a Sub-Folder named "Beta" within the Folder "Alpha"

2) a Sub-Folder named "Beta" within the Folder "Alpha New"

so you to drag "Beta" Sub-Folder from the Folder "Alpha" to the Folder "Alpha New,"

then what will happen?

I ask because in Gmail, it will present a dialogue saying you cannot do that because there is already a Label named "Beta" nested within the Label "Alpha New."

Will Thunderbird give a similar warning, or will it ask if you want to merge the two folders or something?

title: Thunderbird Policies.Json issue
content:
Hi all,

Im looking to only use thunderbird to open emails without access to any other parts of the application. Literally double click an .eml file within windows and get it to open the email and block all access to everything else, including (sorry!) the donation page which causes a browser window to open and we cannot have that (am happy to donate some money if I can block this) as well as the account start up.

So according to the documentation, I just need a policies.json file in a distribution folder, in the program files, thunderbird folder which I have done.

A very shortened JSON copy of this file is as follows: (includes one option that DOES work and one that does not) { 

 "policies": {    "BlockAboutAccounts": true,

"BlockAboutConfig": true, "Preferences": { 

     "app.use_without_mail_account": {        "Value": true,        "Status": "user"      }

} } }

So that works on blocking the about config, but still allows Thunderbird to keep asking for a user account, unless specifying that you do not want to. This happens every time, unless set not to manually.

When setting the change, the prefs.js file within the profile that it creates has the value key name, and the value is the default of "false" unless the config is manually edited and switched off, then it changes to true.

There are no group policies set against Thunderbird so I have no idea why my policies.json "appears" to be getting ignored, though the BlockAboutConfig does work. Perhaps it is not Preferences that it goes against but something else ? (something I was not able to find out in the documentation, but I could not see it).

Any help would be most appreciated but ideally we need: No main app window to appear (so just the email itself would appear) No account request No donation page to appear.

Am happy to contribute some money towards the project if this can be locked down.

Thanks !

Carl

title: Set up OAuth2 in Thunderbird to download messages from https://outlook.live.com/mail/?
content:
I'm runnning Thunderbird 128.0.1esr (64-bit) and use it to download email messages from an outlook.live.com server.

For many weeks now, Microsoft has been sending this warning to my old hotmail accounts: "To help keep your account secure, Microsoft will no longer support the use of third-party email and calendar apps which ask you to sign in with only your Microsoft Account username and password. To keep you safe you will need to use a mail or calendar app which supports Microsoftâ€™s modern authentication methods. If you do not act, your third-party email apps will no longer be able to access your Outlook.com, Hotmail or Live.com email address on September 16th."

I tried switching the POP server setting on one of my hotmail accounts from "Normal password" to OAuth2, but then Thunderbird would stall when I to download mail. So I've had to switch Thunderbird back to "Normal password."

I've asked for help at the Mozillazine Thunderbird forum, but so far no one has been able to figure out a solution to this problem. So I'm hoping to find help here.

title: Backup / Restore IMAP accounts to new host
content:
Hello,

I need to transfer all e-mail accounts of a domain to a new E-mail host. My idea is to configure a thunderbird client in a server with all domain e-mail accounts in order to back up then. When I switch the domain to the new E-mail host, the idea is to use this backup to populate the new accounts on this host.

In order to test my idea, I did the follow steps:

1) Create a new e-mail account 2) Configured Thunderbird with this account (IMAP) and populate it with some messages and folders. 3) Did the Backup of thunderbird account profile. 4) Closed the Thunderbird 5) Iâ€™ve deleted the account a created it again with the same credentials, in order to simulate the account on a new host. 6) Then I Opened Thunderbird and, after synchronize the account, restore the profile.

The problem: As the message sync is done from the host to the client (Thunderbird), All messages restored are deleted. This because the new account have no messages in the host.

Question: Is there a way to use thunderbird to restore all messages of the profile to a new account?

I will need to do this for the almost 90 e-mails accounts of the domain. Anyone know a (free) tool that can do this?

Best Regards,

Marcelo

title: Categorise sent email in folder replied from without creating a copy in 'Sent' folder in Thunderbird
content:
In Outlook, when I navigate to a folder and reply to an email in that folder, the email I send is automatically categorised into that folder, and no other copy appears elsewhere (such as in the 'Sent' folder).

Is this behaviour natively possible in Thunderbird without resorting to an add-on?

I realise there is the option to 'Place replies in the folder of the message being replied to' in the 'Copies & Folders' settings of the email account, but this places a second copy in the 'Sent' folder. I tried experimenting with the radio button options '"Sent" Folder on' and 'Other' in the same settings section, but no combination seems to place one and only one email corresponding to the email I sent in the folder I emailed from without creating a copy in the 'Sent' folder of the account.
